channel.title: Something went screwy
channel.description: Ok i recently added alot of commands, just some fun emote commands and an ::alch command for players on my server. All of a sudden random commands are working. My command for yell is ::yell, but some people can only do it using ::messa or some only ::. I have no clue why this is happening. And commands that worked perfectly now dc my users. The simple alch command dcs them. Help please.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 02, 2009, 08:52:04 am[/size][hr][code]Exception encountered while parsing incoming packets from Oelecthor. java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: -1 at java.lang.String.substring(Unknown Source) at java.lang.String.substring(Unknown Source) at client.customCommand(client.java:7029) at client.parseIncomingPackets(client.java:13901) at client.packetProcess(client.java:15618) at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:271) at process.run(process.java:23) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)[/code] get that every time they do something with ::

item.title: Something went screwy
item.dc:creator: @grimreaper61 grimreaper61
item.description:
@grimreaper61 wrote:

[quote=“m.dog311, post:4, topic:254516”]Maybe you should actually read your error ;). You would then no that the server is screwing itself over because you messed something up with the packet handling.[/quote]to bad i have not touched the packet handling, Only thing i had done is add more commands. Which is why i dont know whats wrong. I was no where near anything to do with how my packets are handled. So i would appreciate you tell me how to fix this rather than tell me i messed something up. Another update, it keeps switching the commands that it affects and uses commands not even coded into the server to do things.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 02, 2009, 12:26:48 pm[/size][hr]bump please

Read full topic

item.title: Something went screwy

item.description:
@firewithin3 wrote:

[quote=“jc22493, post:2, topic:254516”]What?! Please explain better what the problem is.[/quote]He did explain, he even posted the error. He doesn’t have to explain better. Don’t help him if you don’t understand.

@grimreaper61 wrote:

every time someone does any command it wont work. It was fine last time i coded anything, but somehow now nothing works and it dcs everyone.
